abstracts.cdata!:
The Palestinian NGO Project has three
            key objectives: (1) to deliver services to the poor and
            marginalized in Palestinian society, using nongovernmental
            organizations as the delivery mechanism; (2) to improve the
            institutional capacity of NGOs receiving grants under the
            project; and (3) to support efforts by the Palestinian
            Authority (PA) and the Palestinian NGO sector to strengthen
            their working relationship, including support for the
            development of a positive legal framework for the sector.
            The five project components consist of: (1) development
            grants to NGOs in health, education, agriculture, and social
            welfare; (2) hardship grants to selected NGOs providing
            valuable services and currently facing financial difficulty;
            (3) capacity-building grants and research grants to
            qualified institutions or individuals to develop the
            capacity of Palestinian NGOs to plan, manage, and monitor
            projects, to improve information and analysis on the NGO
            sector and/or to benefit NGO relations with the Palestinian
            Authority (PA), to provide capacity-building assistance to
            the project management organization; (4) developing
            legislation and enhancing PA-NGO coordination; and (5)
            project management costs, including hands-on technical
            assistance and audits and evaluation studies.
